sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
What is the chromatic index of the following graph?
![image](https://i.imgur.com/IqTJQ2c.png)
(Note: The edges are not drawn to scale and some may overlap)
message_2:
The chromatic index of a graph is the minimum number of colors needed to color its edges such that no two adjacent edges share the same color.

In the given graph, there are 6 vertices and 9 edges. The graph is a complete bipartite graph, K(3,3), which means it has two sets of vertices (each with 3 vertices) and every vertex in one set is connected to every vertex in the other set.

For a complete bipartite graph K(m,n), the chromatic index is max(m, n). In this case, it's max(3, 3) = 3.

So, the chromatic index of the given graph is 3.
